data.title: Bring your smile and positive attitude. Do not expect smiles back but the food is nice.
data.text: My friends told me that the service/staff are not the warmest. She was right. The food is a little tastier then Del Vikkios (another Italian restaurant in Broomfield). Large portions and the sauce is fine. When we receive a real good coupon deal and just lazy to go to Boulder (Pizza Colour is the BEST) for pizza we order from this place. Call ahead when you want to pick up your pizza. They are nice to their regulars. I always feel like I am inconveniencing them when I go in --- from ordering the food, to waiting for the food to even when I am paying for the food. STRANGE atmosphere.

data.title: Below average taste
data.text: This was not a pizza with flavor at all and it was ordered with ham,mushrooms and pepperoni and all you could taste was pepperoni the sauce tastes like pasta sauce the only thing good about this pizza was the thin crust as for the cheese bread that had good cheese on it but the bread had no flavor at all. The pizza cost $24.95 and it was not worth it at all a frozen pizza for $10.00 would have been a lot better I wouldn't go to this place again ever and if I was you I would go somewhere else

data.title: East coast reviewer Pizza is ok service not so much
data.text: I'm from NJ, pizza is my life.  This place used to be ok for east coast style pizza, but we always have a bad service experience and finally just gave up going.  It's not a cute rude NY attitude in my opinion they just don't seem to care, and that's enough to lose my business and in talking with neighbors we are not alone in our assessment. The pizza is fine, but there are many more options now in this area that don't treat you like you are an inconvenience.  Too bad, or this would still be a go to place for us.

data.title: Always a favorite
data.text: We've been dining here for years. Great pizza, but the eggplant parm is to die for. The Aiello family will take care of your appetite!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Great pizza and garlic knots are to die for! Not too expensive. It's definitely my favorite Italian place.

data.title: The best Italian in Broomfield
data.text: The staff is so nice, the food is cheap and delicious, and this is am all around great place. Good for families and dates. Love it!

data.title: Excellent food completely compensated for service issues
data.text:
A somewhat challenging review: as the food: calzone and cannoli and salad were so good - the cannoli especially: one of the best I've ever had - on par with Boston Little Italy - that it almost overshadows the service issues. Almost.

I found the Service was a bit "brusque" but would be considered standards New Yorker attitude, so they are not being rude, much as it may seem that way. I didn't mind the attitude.
I *did* mind being told my take-out order would take 30 minutes when it actually took 45 - making me wait around for 15 minutes.
The staff seemed highly disorganized -  about what my order was,  where to put my hot calzone in order to box it - actually putting onto a dirty counter while they looked for a box to out it in Ick! Seriously, you can't figure this simple thing out?

Also,  they were not prepared with my salad order or cannoli and I had to re-order both.
So, if the food wasn't excellent I would never come back.
But, it is and I will. If I come back I'd probably eat there and bypass the take-out issues.

Great food, but be prepared for a sub-optimal take-out experience.

data.title: Best ever
data.text: So I go out a lot and this place is family ran place with a little new York  attitude.  You get exactly  what you  see on the menu. They will make some accommodations but don't be a pain in the button. You have to try it.

data.title: Favorite local pizza place!
data.text: We've been going to the Original Pizza for a few years now and it's by far our favorite!  We've also tried their spaghetti & meatballs, which are also good, but the pizza is great and authentic!

data.title: Authentic, delicious Italian food!
data.text: This Italian eatery serves delicious, authentic Italian food made by authentic Italians!!  Family owned and operated for many years at this location.  This speaks to tasty food, good service and atmosphere!   I have taken most members of my family here and several friends--most of which have become Original Pizza regulars when wanting Italian food!

data.title: Good local restaurant
data.text:
It's a long-time Broomfield family restaurant.  Good food the suburbs at a good price.

The owners are an Italian couple originally from New York.  Authentic cuisine, but not a pretentious place.

data.title: Great food, Worth It
data.text: This place had amazing pizza and a good variety of choices on the menu. That combined with a friendly atmosphere and warm, welcoming decorations, this place is definitely worth it.

data.title: Good Pizza spot
data.text: They have a very good GF option, the pies are great... the older guy cooking can seem a bit gruff!  That just added to the experience, seemed more like being in NYC!

data.title: Pizza Ok Skip Lasagna
data.text: Supreme pizza OK, not bad, but nothing special. Lasagna was HORRIBLE!  Served in a giant bowl full of sour tomato sauce, Was cold in the center, couldn't find the ground beef that was supposed to be in it, just a super mushy pile of ricotta cheese. It came with a side salad of ice berg lettuce, black olives and tomato bits. Ranch dressing very good. Also came with some kind of herbed bread that was very good. Took it home to roommate who will eat anything, but even he said "Gross". It went in the trash. They did offer me to choose something else, but since I was going to take it home, I said no thanks. Super casual atmosphere, very noisy, servers almost too attentive, trying to take our plates repeatedly before we were done. Seems to be very popular place with the soccer family crowd, which is not me.

data.title: Our favorite
data.text: There are lots of pizzeria places, and we are very picky, but this is our favorite, second only to Applewood Pizza in Menlo Park, CA.

data.title: New York 100%
data.text: Being that I have lived here in Broomfield for the last 8 years and 100% New Yorker from Queens , this is the best place I have been out side of NYC , if your from New York you will fit in just great but if not forget about it you won't get it ! For the real deal you need to go here ! They also have the best meat balls to !

data.title: Not worth it
data.text: Greasy, bland pizza coupled with unfriendly atmosphere and bad service. Go on down the road !!! There has to be better pizza in Denver !

data.title: pizza done my a family that cares about quality
data.text: ralph the owner, one of the best caring person a community could have, he not only gives his time and effort to the area, but at the same time makes a New York pizza , and sandwiches,pasta, try the fresh eggplant parm sandwich. yum, i fly 10,000 miles once a year just to have a great pizza

data.title: Authentic Italians and Delicious Pizza
data.text: The owners are true Italians that made their way to Broomfield through New York. The pizza is the best pizza I have ever tasted.  It is american size pizza with an incredible Italian quality design and ingredients.  The atmosphere is a lively family styled New York pizza parlor.  The whole family is present in the restaurant and works there...even the newly born baby and his mamma (the owner's daughter).  I think I go there too much, but the family is always happy to welcome you.  Fridays and Saturdays are quite busy so either get there early, oder via phone or just have a nice time in the mix with all the italianess around you.  It is good to be Italian and this place will bring out your national pride.  The Pizza is all that I have eaten, but have seen plenty of others try their other plates (calzones, pastas, eggplant parmesan, etc).  The restaurant is tucked back in a residential area right near highway 36, so if you are in the area or just want the best pizza you have ever had stop by and enjoy the experience.  Bon Appetito

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: First of all, let me say that the pizza is excellent. My wife and I are regulars at Originals and have always enjoyed our meals. We usually have the pizza, but have also shared pasta, Eggplant Parmesan, and other Italian delights. The staff is another reason to dine here. Ralph is a little surly at times, but that just adds to the ambiance. True New York style food and service! If you don't enjoy eating here, you should never bother to visit the Big Apple for pizza.
